For these firms, as well as rivals Blackstone Group LP and KKR & Co., the conditions that have made the last couple of years a good time to sell assets—such as rising stock markets and renewed appetite at big companies for mergers and acquisitions—have presented obstacles to them as buyers.

Carlyle Group LP and Apollo Global Management LLC reported second-quarter results Wednesday showing that, while it is a sellers’ market for private-equity holdings, the firms continue to face challenges making new investments.
